items.content:

Chris Harrelson (Google)

Here, Brewster Kahle shares his thoughts on ‚Äúbuilding a Library of Everything in the digital age‚Äù, and creating such a mammoth historical¬†reference.

‚ÄúI wanted to help make a new medium that would be a step forward from Gutenberg‚Äôs invention hundreds of years before‚Äù

Frontend Focus

#‚Äã500 ‚Äî July 21, 2021 | Read on the web

The Future Of The Web ‚Äî I enjoyed this high-level overview musing on what the web is and what it‚Äôs becoming: ‚Äúit‚Äôs turning from being static, single-player, and centralized to being immersive, multi-player, and¬†decentralized‚Äù.

Hazem Osama opinion

The Performance Effects of Too Much Lazy-loading ‚Äî Too much of a good thing? Here‚Äôs some data-driven advice for when best to use loading="lazy", keeping Core Web Vitals in¬†mind.

Rick Viscomi and Felix Arntz

What If Your Project Management Tool Was Fast and Intuitive? ‚Äî Imagine how much more you could get done if your project management tools didn't make you sigh. Clubhouse is the ideal solution for task management, bug tracking, iteration planning, and reporting. Delight the scrum gods and give us a¬†try.

Clubhouse sponsor

A Bashful Button Worth $8 Million ‚Äî Ah, the old 100vh bug strikes again. This is a solid real-world example (on the Olive Garden site) of just how such an error could prove very¬†costly.

Jason Grigsby

Detecting Media Query Support in CSS and JavaScript ‚Äî To detect if a browser supports a certain CSS feature you‚Äôd typically turn to using @supports, but that doesn‚Äôt work for media queries. Here‚Äôs what you can do about¬†it.

Kilian Valkhof

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • Debugging JavaScript in Visual Studio Code is now built-in.
  • The latest episode of the CSS Podcast, featuring Google's Una Kravets and Adam Argyle, goes into detail on styling SVG with CSS.
  • Version 6.2 of Polypane, the browser for web devs, is out now.
  • When was the last time you tested your site on a slow connection? Here's how to throttle your speeds to do just that.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Of Course We Can Make a CSS-Only Clock That Tells the Current Time ‚Äî A fun exercise creating a fully functioning and settable ‚Äúanalog‚Äù clock using CSS custom properties and the calc() function.

Mate Marschalko

From A Colourblind Designer To The World: Please Stop Using Red And Green Together ‚Äî Deuteranopia is a common kind of colourblindness ‚Äî¬†here the author outlines why red and green can prove problematic when paired and what you can do about¬†it.

Andrew Wilshere

Dark Mode Web App Manifest App Icons ‚Äî Yep, you can have SVG app icons that are dark mode aware. But there are some caveats to be aware¬†of.

Thomas Steiner

Inspecting Sizes ‚Äî Dev tools can easily toggle between RGB, HSL, and hex values ‚Äî but wouldn‚Äôt it be nice to have such a switch for sizing too (pixels, ems, etc). Well, you do have some¬†options.

Michelle Barker

React Authentication, Simplified ‚Äî In this article, we lay out a new approach to authentication (plus access control & SSO) in React¬†applications.

Userfront sponsor

Maintaining End-To-End Quality With Visual Testing ‚Äî A detailed look at how visual testing can prove a valuable addition to your testing¬†coverage.

Colby Fayock

Can Opera Finally Sing On Google's Chromebooks and Windows 11? ‚Äî A chat with the Opera team about the R5 update (available now), and the browsers plans for Windows¬†11.

Daryl Baxter

The Accessibility Stalemate ‚Äî On how well meaning, and often excellent accessibility advice, doesn‚Äôt reach the audience it ought¬†to.

Christian Heilmann

It‚Äôs A (Front-End Testing) Trap! Six Common Testing Pitfalls And How To Solve Them

Ramona Schwering

Creating a Typography Motion Trail Effect with Three.js
George Nikolov

Typewriter Animation That Handles Anything You Throw at It
Murtuzaali Surti

Two Simple Ways You Can Truncate Text using CSS
Kritika Pattalam Bharathkumar

Jobs

Frontend Developer at X-Team (Remote) ‚Äî Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, and¬†more.
X-Team

Hired

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

Unicode Arrows ‚Äî Yes, it‚Äôs a neat collection of all the ‚Üí unicode arrows ‚Üê you may ever need, but also¬†jewelry‚Ä¶

Rachel Binx

Toolb: 50+ Free Web Tools for Your Daily Workflow ‚Äî This has just about everything! A real grab bag that includes converters and code generators for CSS, HTML, and JS, along with some other unique tools for manipulating text and¬†images.

Rachid Daoudi

Free Chat/Messaging UI Kits for Your Website or App

Stream sponsor

Counter Styles Converter ‚Äî This online tool lets you see what is produced for a given number or sequence of numbers by the algorithms described by the CSS3 Counter Styles spec and the new Ready-Made Counter Styles by the¬†W3C.

Richard Ishida

Nativefier: Make Any Web Page A Desktop Application ‚Äî A basic Node.js-powered tool for creating a desktop ‚Äòapp‚Äô for any Web site using Electron as the webview. For Windows, macOS and¬†Linux.

Goh Jia Hao

spacers: A JS Library to Control Spacing Around Elements ‚Äî This is loosely based on the old-school idea of using ‚Äúspacer‚Äù images to help with layouts. The API includes 15+ configurations for various spacer¬†settings.

Akash Gupta
